message.content:
cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with a scheduling problem, which is a classic topic in computer science and falls under the category of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The use of non-decreasing functions to specify the cost incurred for each possible completion time suggests a connection to game theory (cs.GT) and optimization (cs.NE). The mention of approximation algorithms and the goal of finding a schedule of minimum cost suggest a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
